translated: “According to the brahmins’ tradition,

analyzed: lo bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad kyi bar du tshangs par spyod pa spyad nas de'i 'og tu chung ma len par byed kyi /

analyzed: 'on kyang bdag gis 'tshal ma bde blag tu 'tshal du mchis so //

original: bram zes smras pa /

analyzed: bzang mo // mi dga' bar ma byed cig /

analyzed: bram ze 'di nga'i bstan pa la rab tu byung nas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs te dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ba zhig na; de 'di lta bu'i gzu lums byed cing 'dug go snyam du dgongs nas bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod
translated: The Blessed One went to Śrāvastī

analyzed: srog phangs pa ma dor cig ces bka' stsal nas bcom ldan 'das slar gtsug lag khang du gshegs so //

analyzed: de nas phyi zhig na /

analyzed: dge sbyong go'u ta ma ni /

analyzed: bdag khyim na gnas pa btang la de'i thad du rab tu 'byung bar bya'o snyam ste khyim gyi 'khor btang @140b nas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te chos mnyan pa'i phyir spyan sngar
translated: He thought, “I will give up living in a household and go forth in his presence.” He gave up his household affairs, went to the Blessed One, and upon his arrival bowed his head at the Blessed One’s feet and sat before him to listen to the Dharma.

translated: He too, through diligence, practice, and effort, abandoned all the defilements and actualized the state of an arhat.

analyzed: 'bras sa lu dang bu ram shing dang ba lang dang ma he dang ldan par 'dug ste /

analyzed: gnod pa med cing tsher ma bkrugs la bu gcig pa sdug pa la bya ba bzhin du chos bzhin du rgyal srid byed do //

original: rgyal po de yang byams pa'i bdag nyid can /
analyzed: rgyal po de yang byams pa'i bdag nyid can /

original: snying rje dang ldan pa /

analyzed: sems can la byams pa / sbyin @141b ba la dga' ba zhig ste /

original: des sbyin pa dag sbyin zhing bsod nams dag byed de /

analyzed: dge sbyong dang / bram ze dang / sdug cing phongs pa dang / bkren pa rnams la ci dang ci 'dod pa sbyin par byed do //
translated: He gives to ascetics, brahmins, the poor, the destitute, and beggars whatever they desire.

original: bza' ba dang / bca' ba mang po dag sta gon byas te srog chags nam mkha' la gnas pa dang / chu na gnas pa dang / thang la gnas pa rnams la sbyin par byed do; ;'jig rten dag kyang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la 'god par byed do //🔽de phyin chad bdag gis sems can rnams la thams cad sbyin no //
analyzed: bza' ba dang / bca' ba mang po dag sta gon byas te srog chags nam mkha' la gnas pa dang / chu na gnas pa dang / thang la gnas pa rnams la sbyin par byed do; ;'jig rten dag kyang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la 'god par byed do // de phyin chad bdag gis sems can rnams la thams cad sbyin no //
translated: He prepares many kinds of food and drink and gives them to living beings in the sky, in the water, and on the land. He establishes the world in the ten wholesome courses of action.

original: zhes dam bcas so //
analyzed: zhes dam bcas so //
translated: From that time on, he made the vow to give everything to sentient beings.

original: de chos bzhin du rgyal po byed pas mi dang mi ma yin pa rnams kyis kyang de la bsrung ba dang / bskyab pa dang / spa ba'i phyir brtson par byed do //
analyzed: de chos bzhin du rgyal po byed pas mi dang mi ma yin pa rnams kyis kyang de la bsrung ba dang / bskyab pa dang / spa ba'i phyir brtson par byed do //
translated: Because he ruled in accordance with the Dharma, humans and non-humans exerted themselves in protecting, guarding, and defending him.

original: de dag gis dus dus su char gyi rgyun legs par 'bebs shing  rnams rgyas par byed do //
analyzed: de dag gis dus dus su char gyi rgyun legs par 'bebs shing  rnams rgyas par byed do //
translated: From time to time they caused rain to fall and made the crops grow.

original: rgyal po de'i 'dabs kyi nyi 'og gi rgyal po ni /
analyzed: rgyal po de'i 'dabs kyi nyi 'og gi rgyal po ni /
translated: The king of a neighboring country

original: chos ma yin pas rgyal po byed de /
analyzed: chos ma yin pas rgyal po byed de /
translated: was ruling unjustly.

original: shing sgrog dang / rkang sgril dang / lag sgril dang / aan phan gdags pa rnams kyis yul na gnas pa'i skya bo mang po la gnod pa byed de /
analyzed: shing sgrog dang / rkang sgril dang / lag sgril dang / aan phan gdags pa rnams kyis yul na gnas pa'i skya bo mang po la gnod pa byed de /

analyzed: de'i mi rnams nan gyis dpya bla skyes rgyud mas 'jigs te rgyal po dbang chen sde'i yul du dong ste 'khod do //
translated: The people, being oppressed and terrified by the king’s heavy taxes, fled to the country of King Mahendrasena and settled there.

original: de nas phyi zhig na nyi 'og gi rgyal po de blon po mang pos zham ring byas nas yul bltar song song ba las des bltas nas grong dang / grong @142a *//
analyzed: de nas phyi zhig na nyi 'og gi rgyal po de blon po mang pos zham ring byas nas yul bltar song song ba las des bltas nas grong dang / grong @142a *//
translated: Later, the neighboring king, accompanied by many ministers, went to see the country. He saw that the towns,

analyzed: khyer dang / grong rdal dang / nags khrod kyi grong dang / tshong dus dag stongs par mthong nas blon po rnams la kva'i /
translated: cities, villages, forest villages, and markets were empty. He asked his ministers, “Hey!🔽Why has the country become almost empty?”

analyzed: ci'i phyir yul stongs la thug par gyur ces dris nas blon po rnams na re /
translated: The ministers said,🔽“Your Majesty, the people are fleeing to the country of King Mahendrasena.”

analyzed: lha / rgyal po dbang chen sde'i yul 'byor ba dang / rgyas pa dang / bde ba dang / lo legs pa dang ldan la /

analyzed: skye bo mang po de dag kyang dpya khral ma mchis pa dang 'dra bar 'khod pas na /

original: skye bo phal po che rnams der dong ste 'khod do //
analyzed: skye bo phal po che rnams der dong ste 'khod do //
translated: So the great multitude went there and settled down.

original: zhes zer ro //
analyzed: zhes zer ro //

analyzed: de dag yon 'gyed pa'i tshe 'thab mo chen po byung nas der ljongs na gnas pa'i bram ze rnams na re /

analyzed: @168b mthil na gnas pa'i bram ze rnams na re /

analyzed: khyod ni / zhing blas kyis 'tsho ba tshol ba yin gyi / nged ni / yon gnas yin te /

translated: We are worthy of being given gifts in order of rank.”

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bgrod pa gcig pu'i lam ston pa /

analyzed: mi 'jigs bzhis 'jigs pa med pa /

analyzed: mtshan dus gsum ste nyin mtshan dus drug tu sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la gzigs te /

original: su ni / rgud /
analyzed: su ni / rgud /

analyzed: nyes par spyod pa'i 'dam du bying ba las lag nas drang bar bya /

analyzed: su ni / 'phags pa'i nor bdun med pa las 'phags pa'i nor bdun gyi dbang phyug la dbang byed du gzhug par bya /

analyzed: su ni / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams ma bskyed pa las bskyed par bya /

analyzed: su ni / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams yongs su smin zin pa las ye shes kyi mtshon gyis brtol bar bya /

analyzed: su ni / sangs rgyas byung bas brgyan pa'i 'jig rten 'bras bu yod par bya snyam du ye shes gzigs pa 'jug go /
